p: A possible scenario of A. albopictus involvement in DENV and ZIKV transmission in Brazil imposes a concern on the transmission increases, on the establishment of a bridge between sylvatic, rural and urban cycles [ 15, 51, 52], and on the maintenance of the virus in the environment in non-epidemic periods [ 5]. In the face of some characteristics of this vector, such as the reports its resistance to some insecticides [ 9, 11, 12], the use of natural and artificial breeding sites [ 24], and the broad distribution with ecological plasticity, a possible “ruralization” of DENV and ZIKV may impose additional challenges for the control of these viruses.
